pros: Excellent communication between employees. Efficient software used for notes.
cons: The patient load will occasionally slow down.

pros: Able to provide direct care to one patient at a time.
cons: Get everything in writing before accepting a job. Management is sweet as can be if they know they can keep filling your plate. Otherwise, plan on being a work horse with no time for anything else. You can keep reaching but they're great at moving the goal posts.

pros: -LGBTQ Friendly -Flexible schedules -Sometimes free food -Could use the company car if your car is in the shop.
cons: -As a “Contractor Driver” you’re not on 1099 tax form nope.. you’re on a W2 in which is very misleading since those who know if you are employed as a Contractor or Independent Driver you would be on a 1099 tax form. -Manager plays favoritism especially on LGBTQ as he’s a member as well. Not against LGBTQ but that’s how he likes to run the warehouse. -You can get away with things if the manager likes you even if it’s severe. -You get on the managers bad side he will use his so called power to make you deliver a route that has just heavy boxes and Enteral Boxes. -The company does not value their hard workers enough. Only sometimes. -The manager praises those who don’t work hard and just accepts every little excuse that one would have to say. -The manager isn’t really a manager. It’s unbelievable to experience working in an environment where the Coordinator works more than the manager. -The App that they make us use to scan the barcodes and have patients sign on really needs some improvements - The LTC PO side need to work on timely orders and not have us drivers wait as we don’t get paid hourly but per stop. -There will be days where you’ll be waiting thirty minutes to an hour just for the meds to come out.
